original_title: 3D Print A Stenciling Frame For Your PCB
original_content:
For many a hacker, stenciling a board for the first time is a game-changing experience  the solder joints you get, sure do give your PCB the aura of a mass-manufactured device. Now, you might not get a perfect print  and neither did [Atul R]. Not to worry, because if you have a 3D printer handy, hes showing you how to design a 3D-printed frame using Blender and TinkerCAD, making your solder paste print well even if youre trying to rest a giant stencil on top of a tiny board.
[Atul]s situation was non-characteristic  the project is a 2mm thick PCB designed to plug right into a USB port, so the usual trick of using some scrap PCBs wouldnt work, and using a 3D-printed frame turned out to be key. To get it done, he exported a .wrl from KiCad, processed it in Blender, and then designed a frame with help of TinkerCAD. These techniques, no doubt, will translate into your CAD of choice  especially if you go with .step export instead of .wrl.
This kind of frame design will get you far, especially for boards where the more common techniques fail  say, if you need to assemble a double-sided board and one side is already populated. Dont have a stencil? You could surely make a 3D printed stencil, too, both for KiCad boards and for random Gerber files. Oh, and dont forget this 3D-printable stencil alignment jig, while youre at it  looks like it ought to save you quite a bit of trouble.
title: ハッカー必見！PCB用3Dプリントフレームの作成方法
body: ハッカーにとってステンシルを使ったボードは革命的な体験。きっちり印刷するためBlenderとTinkerCADを使用した3Dフレームの設計方法を紹介。.stepエクスポートも可能。ダブルサイドボードの組立や印刷ステンシルの作成も可能。
